H0.text: Which Shakespeare play tells the story of Prospero, the rightful Duke of Milan. The Tempest

H1.text: Which Shakespeare play tells the story of Prospero, the rightful Duke of Milan. A Midsummer Night's Dream

H2.text: Which Shakespeare play tells the story of Prospero, the rightful Duke of Milan. The Merchant of Venice

H3.text: Which Shakespeare play tells the story of Prospero, the rightful Duke of Milan. EMSEC

A4.text: The Tempest is a play by William Shakespeare, probably written in 1610â€“1611, and thought to be one of the last plays that he wrote alone.

A5.text: After the first scene, which takes place on a ship at sea during a tempest (bad storm), the rest of the story is set on a remote island, where Prospero, a magician, lives with his daughter Miranda, and his two servants: Caliban, a savage monster figure, and Ariel, an airy spirit.
